result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Keith J Eggum appeared by video, in custody from Waupun Correctional.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been in contact with any attorneys. Court heard on contacting attorneys. Defendant heard. Court heard and will appoint an attorney. Defendant heard on representing himself. Court heard on defendant representing himself. Court mutes defendant due to profanity. Defendant kicks video conference system and DOC removed defendant from room. State heard and requests a $2500 cash bond. Court heard and orders $2500 cash bond. Status date set.
faxed to Waupun 10-27-22 kb

Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Keith J Eggum appeared by video, in custody at Waupun Correctional.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews letter received by defendant. Defendant heard on not wanting to hire an attorney that he does not know and considers representing himself. Court heard on Attorney Meyer O'Day. Defendant would like to meet with Attorney Meyer O'Day before he decides to retain him. Court will reach out to Attorney Meyer O'Day. Attorney Pozorski heard and will send a plea offer to defendant. Status continued.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Keith J Eggum appeared by video, in custody at Waupun Correctional.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court asks defendant if he can hear, defendant holds up "yes" sign. Court heard on defendant's requests to represent himself. Court reviews jury trial process with defendant. Defendant answers question by holding up signs. Defendant heard on testifying and possible witness. Defendant heard on wanting to shop around for an attorney but is having issues doing that while being in prison. Defendant does not want a Public Defender. Defendant would still like to proceeded with trial next week. Attorney Pozorski heard. Court heard and cancels trial for next week. Discusses court appointed attorney with defendant and deposit. Court sets status date.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Keith J Eggum appeared by video, in custody from Waupun Correctional. Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not contact SPD. Court reviews counsel options with defendant. Defendant refusing to speak- holds up signs. Jerry Vesperman sworn and testified. Defendant nods head "no" to cross examination. State requests bind over. Court finds probable cause to bind matter over. Information filed. Court reviews criminal complaint with defendant. Defendant holds up not guilty card, speedy trial, and wanting to represent self. Court discusses self representation. Court will issue a trial date after the July 6th statuses. Defendant holds sign saying discovery. Attorney Pozorski will send discovery. Court finds that defendant waives right to attorney due to conduct. At this time, Court will let defendant represent himself.
Review scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
From Captain Esser w/WSPF re:6/6/22 hearing

Defendant Keith J Eggum appeared by video, in custody from WSPF.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant refuses to acknowledge court. Per guards, defendant can hear proceedings and is refusing to respond. Defendant continually flashes cards (not guilty, speedy trial, double jeopardy, etc.). Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Court advises defendant that he will not be forced to appear in future. His refusal to leave cell will be deemed a waiver of appearance. SPD will be contacting defendant. Court advises defendant to cooperate. If defendant refuses to speak, he cannot represent himself or work with counsel. State does not request bond. Bond not necessary. Court sets review.
Review scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:00 am.
From Def. w/attachments
